sections.title: Retainers & retention after straightening
sections.body: Whether you finished fixed braces or clear aligners, retainers keep teeth steady once active movement ends. We map a plan with you so wear times, reviews, and replacement options feel clear from the start.
bullets: Support after braces or aligners with steady guidance
Removable and fixed options explained before fitting
Calm language about wear times and check-ups
Quick repairs or replacements if something changes

sections.title: Fixed or removable retainers made to fit
items: Removable Essix-style retainers worn nightly to hold teeth once braces or aligners finish.
Fixed/bonded retainers placed behind front teeth where suitable to help maintain alignment with little visual impact.
Lab-made retainers produced to your scan or impressions, with 3D printed options used where they suit the appliance—never implied for every case.
We explain when to combine fixed and removable retainers for extra stability.

sections.eyebrow: Which retainer is right for you?
sections.title: Simple guidance to choose a retainer
items: Prefer easy cleaning and don’t mind nightly wear? A removable retainer is often the simplest route.
Want discreet, always-on support? A bonded retainer may suit, with checks to keep it clean and intact.
Finished aligners and want belt-and-braces stability? Pair a bonded retainer with a removable night retainer.
Had previous relapse after braces? We’ll discuss how long-term wear and review intervals help hold your result.
Unsure what fits your lifestyle? We’ll map options with photos and timelines so you can decide calmly.

sections.title: Keep retainers fresh and comfortable
items: Removable retainers: rinse after removal, brush gently with cool water and mild soap, avoid hot water, and store in a ventilated case.
Avoid toothpaste or harsh cleaners on clear retainers to prevent scratches; use approved retainer cleanser when advised.
Bonded retainers: clean with floss threaders or interdental brushes to prevent plaque around the wire and glue points.
Let us know if floss catches or a section lifts—small repairs protect against unwanted movement.
Regular hygiene visits help keep bonded retainers and gums healthy.

sections.title: Help if a retainer is lost, cracked, or loose
sections.body: Retainers can wear over time. If yours is damaged or your bonded retainer lifts, contact us quickly so we can check stability and prevent drift.
bullets: Lost or cracked removable retainer? We can scan or take impressions to make a replacement.
Bonded retainer feels loose? Book a review so we can rebond or replace the wire before teeth move.
Noticing small gaps returning? Early tweaks or new retainers can correct minor relapse faster.
Bring your retainer case to appointments so we can check fit and clean it safely.

sections.title: Answers about keeping teeth in place

faqs.question: How long do I need to wear retainers?
faqs.answer: Retention is long-term. We often suggest nightly removable wear and regular bonded retainer checks to keep teeth steady for years.

faqs.question: Will a fixed retainer affect speech?
faqs.answer: Most people adapt quickly. A bonded retainer sits behind the teeth and usually feels smooth after a short settling-in period.

faqs.question: Can I clean a removable retainer with toothpaste?
faqs.answer: We recommend cool water, a soft brush, and mild soap instead—abrasive toothpaste can scratch clear retainers.

faqs.question: What if my bonded retainer wire breaks?
faqs.answer: Contact us promptly. Avoid pulling at the wire, and use a removable retainer if you have one until we repair or replace it.

faqs.question: Do retainers affect eating or drinking?
faqs.answer: Remove clear retainers for meals and hot drinks. If you have a bonded retainer, you can eat as normal but avoid biting hard items on the bonded teeth.

faqs.question: Can I wear retainers while playing sport?
faqs.answer: Use a sports mouthguard over the bonded retainer. Remove clear retainers for contact sport and store them safely in a case.

faqs.question: How often should retainers be checked?
faqs.answer: We’ll agree a review cadence—often annually or sooner if you notice movement, tightness, or damage.

sections.strapline: Book a quick check or plan a replacement retainer before teeth shift.
